Florida Officers Find Shark and Alligator in Same Creek

By Stephanie Valera 05.20.2019 :: 3:28PM EDT 05.20.2019

  • Facebook
  • Twitter
  • Linkedin
  • Pinterest
  • Google Plus
  • Reddit
  • Hacker News
  • Flipboard
  • Email

  • 0shares

Stay on target

  • Alligator Captured in Pittsburgh After ‘Trying to Hide From Office...
  • Alligator Blocks Runway at Air Force Base in Florida

In what might be “the most Florida” thing of the week, officers spotted a shark and an alligator in the same freshwater creek in Gainesville — over 60 miles away from the nearest beach.

The Alachua County Sheriff’s Office tweeted on Sunday that deputies found a dead, 5-foot shark and a live alligator in Lake Forest Creek after responding to a call.

“The most Florida call of the week: shark and gator in the same creek. Never a dull moment,” the Alachua County Sheriff’s Office posted on Twitter.

Officials made sure to say, however, that the creek, which is located off East University Avenue, isn’t shark-infested.

“Don’t worry … this 5 1/2 footer was caught elsewhere and dumped,” they said. “Deputies responded — just in case.”

It’s unclear who dumped the shark in the creek, but alligators have been known to find themselves in weird situations in Florida. Just last week, an alligator was spotted blocking the runway at a MacDill Air Force Base, and earlier this month, a woman pulled a live gator from her yoga pants during a traffic stop.
